column5: I'm not sure if this would be the proper way to dispose of an inexpensive 'found' rod & reel, but I guess it's worth a try. This aforementioned 'combo' is likely under $100.00, which was 'donated' to the salmon Gods in the last week or 2 . . . .  somebody learned the hard way why you NEVER lay a rod & reel down, and take your eyes off it. If YOU lost it, just tell me what make & model it was, and in what stretch of the Ganny you lost it, I'll try to arrange getting it back to you. I'll give it about a week, if no owner shows up, I know someone who would gladly accept it.
Very nice of you! I'm gonna try guessing, Shakespeare ugly stick with a Shimano Sahara? did I win?
Sure nice to know there are still some good people out there.
Hey, i cant believe there are actually more people out here that have a heart and are not so selfish ..... Good on you man !  Troy~
my fenwick and phluger (SP?) was found?  good on ya for offering to give it back to the owner.
Youse is a good man Steve, tells your mother !!!  besides, you need another rod and reel like you need another hole in your head...

when i was a kid maybe 10 or 12. We were fishing at the mouth of the ganaraska, just bottom bouncing and i put my rod down next to me and it was a gone. Hahaha, my uncle had just warned me too.  I have never made that mistake again
Was it an 13' okuma rod with a greys buick float reel?
If so, that person doesn't deserve it back, go catch a musky with it.
No Sinclair - it was an R2F 5' kids model with 80 lb power pro!  (if you only knew how many of those I actually see!)  Michael
My buddy told me about one of his friends that lost a combo down in the trench last week, ill pass the msg through.
